intro: Psychotria haematocarpa, commonly known as the "blood vine," is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark red or purplish stems and leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by bright red berries. It contains various alkaloids, including cocaine, which has contributed to its historical and medicinal significance. Due to its toxic properties, it is often found in shaded, humid environments within rainforests.
